messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] word cards/posters WAS strewing
messages.msgSnippet: ... i love this idea, pam!  i think my eve (6) will find it very helpful..i ll ask her about it today.  she s in a language explosion with her reading all of a
messages.messageBody:
>We did cards, too, like Sandra described - and I also put up a big
>blank piece of poster paper on a wall and when there was a word my kid
>wanted to know, I'd write it on there. So then they'd know it was there
>in the future. No order, not even lined up - just words scrawled all
>over the page - willy-nilly. The first words they learned were things
>like "alligator" and "umbrella" along with "the" and "from" and "love."

i love this idea, pam! i think my eve (6) will find it very
helpful..i'll ask her about it today. she's in a language explosion with
her reading all of a sudden...it's truly amazing to watch her take the
reigns and go with it where she needs/wants to. :)

love,
lisa

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
